result.markdown:
--- title: "Fall 2022 Workshop Survey Responses" author: "Seth Erickson" date: 2022-11-29 editor: visual format: html: df-print: kable --- ## Combined Workshop Survey Responses ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library("tidyverse") # list of workshop IDs to filter results workshops <- c("2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets", "2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git", "2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R", "2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs") results <- read_csv("data-joined/all_workshops.csv") %>% filter(workshop %in% workshops) ``` ::: ## Departments ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% select(dept_select.pre) %>% separate_rows(dept_select.pre, sep=",") %>% group_by(dept_select.pre) %>% summarise(count=n()) %>% arrange(desc(count)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|dept_select.pre | count| |:---------------|-----:| |Other | 3| |Anthropology | 1| |Geography | 1| |NA | 1|
::: ::: ### "Other" Departments ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(dept_other.pre) %>% summarise(count=n()) %>% arrange(desc(count)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|dept_other.pre | count| |:--------------|-----:| |NA | 3| |Physics | 2| |ICBT | 1|
::: ::: ## Occupation ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% select(occupation.pre) %>% separate_rows(occupation.pre, sep=",") %>% group_by(occupation.pre) %>% summarise(count=n()) %>% arrange(desc(count)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|occupation.pre | count| |:------------------|-----:| |Graduate Student | 4| |Postdoc Researcher | 1| |NA | 1|
::: ::: ## Motivations ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% select(motivation_select.pre) %>% separate_rows(motivation_select.pre, sep=",") %>% group_by(motivation_select.pre) %>% summarise(count=n()) %>% arrange(desc(count)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|motivation_select.pre | count| |:----------------------------------------------------------|-----:| |To learn new skills | 5| |To learn skills that I can apply to my current work | 4| |To learn skills that I can apply to my work in the future | 4| |To learn skills that will help me get a job or a promotion | 2| |To refresh or review my skills | 2| |NA | 1|
::: ::: ## Hopes ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% select(workshop, hopes.pre) %>% drop_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |hopes.pre | |:------------------------|:----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Version control and batch processes | |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Git version control and managing coding projects through git; | |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Although I use the unix shell a lot, I have never had any formal training, so I think this will be helpful to make sure I am doing everything correctly. I will also most likely have to use Git in the future for my work, so I would love to learn how to use it properly. |
::: ::: ## Applying the material ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop,agree_apply.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_apply.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_apply.post | count| |:------------------------|:-------------------------|-----:| |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Neither Agree or Disagree | 1| |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Somewhat Agree | 1| |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Strongly Agree | 2|
::: ::: ## Comfortable in the workshop environment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop,agree_comfortable.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_comfortable.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_comfortable.post | count| |:------------------------|:----------------------|-----:| |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Strongly Agree | 4|
::: ::: ## Got clear answers ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop,agree_clearanswers.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_clearanswers.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_clearanswers.post | count| |:------------------------|:-----------------------|-----:| |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Strongly Agree | 4|
::: ::: ## Instructors were enthusiastic ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop,agree_instr_enthusiasm.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_instr_enthusiasm.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_instr_enthusiasm.post | count| |:------------------------|:---------------------------|-----:| |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Somewhat Disagree | 1| |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Strongly Agree | 3|
::: ::: ## Comfortable interacting with instructors ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop,agree_instr_interaction.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_instr_interaction.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_instr_interaction.post | count| |:------------------------|:----------------------------|-----:| |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Strongly Agree | 4|
::: ::: ## Instructors were knowledgeable ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop, agree_instr_knowledge.post) %>% select(workshop, agree_instr_knowledge.post) %>% drop_na() %>% summarize(count=n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |agree_instr_knowledge.post | count| |:------------------------|:--------------------------|-----:| |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Strongly Agree | 4|
::: ::: ## Instructor interaction example ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% select(workshop, instructor_example.post) %>% drop_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |instructor_example.post | |:------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Seth went out of his way to research the answers to the very specific questions I asked. It was really fun talking about how bash scripts work and how to do version control and how the conventions are. | |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |instructor gave nice graphic explanation to help me understand abstract concept | |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |They were very responsive to questions and ensured everyone was always caught up! | |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Instructors clearly explained the promised topics, provided useful applications examples, and helped with troubleshooting as we followed along. They listened carefully to questions and provided thoughtful answers based on their expertise. I feel comfortable applying the bash scripting techniques immediately and feel much more up to speed on Git basics-- enough to experiment with it on my own in the future. |
::: ::: ## Workshop Strengths ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% select(workshop, workshop_strengths.post) %>% drop_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |workshop_strengths.post | |:------------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Specific questions were answered. We received a lot of one-on-one guidance because it was so small. | |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Easy to catch up for a beginner. Our problems can be solved immediately. | |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |'-the small workshop size I thought actually made it better for my personal learning; -the flexibility of the instructors meant all of my questions were answered | |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Good coverage of topics and examples; Instructor expertise; Friendly, inviting atmosphere |
::: ::: ## Ways to improve the workshop ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% select(workshop, workshop_improved.post) %>% drop_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |workshop_improved.post | |:------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Depending on the size, I would say restructuring it to be more of a seminar/discussion type was more appealing for the last 2 days of the workshop to me. I felt I got a lot more out of it. | |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |maybe more effective ad for more students to attend. also, sometimes it just hard to find a free schedule for 3 consecutive days for students. | |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |It was sad it almost got cancelled! Some advertisement improvements could be made to ensure at least a slightly larger attendance. At least enough to make it financially viable | |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |The workshop was great. More time with the instructors-- another day or two-- would have been valuable. For additional hands on experience with some of the concepts and to dig into more sophisticated aspects of those. |
::: ::: ## Topic Suggestions ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% select(workshop, suggest_topics.post) %>% drop_na() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
|workshop |suggest_topics.post | |:------------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |time series data analysis using R | |2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git |Pandas dataframes in Python, intro to Julia, and how to use the cluster (although I know there is already a seminar on that this week!) |
::: :::
